articles.title: More Than 3,700 People Quarantined on Cruise Ship After Passenger Is Diagnosed With Coronavirus
articles.description: Thousands of passengers and crew members on board the Diamond Princess cruise ship have been quarantined off the coast of Yokohama, near Tokyo, Japan.

articles.title: Wuhan Doctor Allegedly Silenced by Police For Trying to Alert People to Coronavirus Tests Positive for Virus
articles.description: The doctor started coughing and developed a fever after treating a patient at the hospital in Wuhan where he works.
articles.content:
About a month after Li Wenliang, a Chinese doctor, alerted his medical school classmates about a new coronavirus, he was diagnosed with it.

articles.author: Brendan Cole
articles.title: Coronavirus Will Hurt China's Economy More Than SARS and Lower Its Growth for 2020, Economists Warn
articles.description: The epidemic hit Chinese markets hard on Monday amid fears the disease could harm long-term growth in the world's second-biggest economy.
articles.content:
The coronavirus will have a bigger economic impact on China than the 2003 SARS outbreak, experts have warned, with forecasts for the country's 2020 growth downgraded significantly.

articles.title: Coronavirus Trade Ban Sees Frozen Eagles, Leopard Cats, Raccoons and Squirrels Due to Be Sold As Meat Seized in China
articles.description: Hundreds of frozen animal carcasses have been seized in a raid after Chinese authorities promise to crackdown on unregulated meat trade.
articles.content:
Authorities have seized hundreds of frozen carcasses, including raccoons and leopard cats, from a refrigerator facility in Pingguo, southeast China, over fears the illegal meat could be harboring diseases akin to the coronavirus.

articles.title: Coronavirus Infects 1-Month-Old Baby in China, Health Officials Say
articles.description: The new form of the coronavirus dubbed 2019-nCoV has killed over 400 people since late last year.
articles.content:
A baby in China has been diagnosed with the mysterious new coronavirus which has killed over 400 people, according to health officials.

articles.title: Coronavirus Patient Dies in Hong Kong, Marking Second Death Outside Mainland China
articles.description: Hong Kong officials said a patient suffering from coronavirus died early Tuesday, the second death reported outside mainland China.
articles.content:
